evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: On March 27, 2025, President Trump issued Executive Order 14251, Exclusions from Federal Labor-Management Relations Programs, 90 Fed. Reg. 14553 (Apr. 3, 2025) (EO 14251).

extracted.value: On March 27, 2025, President Trump issued Executive Order 14251, Exclusions from Federal Labor-Management Relations Programs.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: On March 6, 2025 memorandum for agency heads from President Trump stating that “in recent weeks, activist organizations …”

extracted.value: On March 6, 2025, President Trump issued a memorandum to agency heads demanding action against unions.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: On March 13, 2025, in a case brought by AFGE, AFSCME, local unions, and non‑profit organizations, a federal judge granted a preliminary injunction from the bench that required reinstatement of thousands of fired probationary workers at the Departments of Veterans Affairs, Agriculture, Interior, Energy, Defense, and Treasury. AFGE v. Ezell, No. C‑25‑01780‑WHA, 2025 WL 820782 (N.D. Cal. Mar. 14, 2025).

extracted.value: On March 13, 2025, a federal judge granted a preliminary injunction requiring reinstatement of thousands of fired probationary workers at the Departments of Veterans Affairs, Agriculture, Interior, Energy, Defense, and Treasury.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: On March 21, AFSCME and AFGE joined journalists, other unions, and non‑profit press‑freedom organizations to challenge the Trump Administration’s dismantlement.

extracted.value: On March 21, AFSCME and AFGE joined journalists, other unions, and non‑profit press‑freedom organizations to challenge the Trump Administration’s dismantlement.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: On March 24, 2025 temporary restraining order ... granted on March 28.

extracted.value: On March 24, 2025, a temporary restraining order was filed and granted on March 28.

evidence.text: On March 31, 2025 ... Local 1998 of the NFFE was informed ... that “effective immediately, the Department hereby terminates the Collective Agreement with NFFE Local 1998 and will no longer recognize NFFE as an exclusively recognized labor organization.”

extracted.value: On March 31, 2025, Local 1998 of the NFFE was informed that the Collective Agreement was terminated and the NFFE would no longer be recognized.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: The White House Fact Sheet accompanying the Exclusion Order decried actions by ‘hostile Federal unions’ who had ‘declared war on President Trump’s agenda’.

extracted.value: The White House Fact Sheet accompanying the Exclusion Order decried actions by ‘hostile Federal unions’ who had ‘declared war on President Trump’s agenda’.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Plaintiffs have engaged in extensive speech and petitioning activity that has been broadly critical of ‘Trump’s agenda’.

extracted.value: Plaintiffs have engaged in extensive speech and petitioning activity that has been broadly critical of ‘Trump’s agenda’.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: The Exclusion Order stripped the vast majority of federal workers of their right to organize and bargain collectively.

extracted.value: The Exclusion Order stripped the vast majority of federal workers of their right to organize and bargain collectively.
